name: English Hawthorn
climate: Temperate climates with mild summers and cool winters are suitable for English Hawthorn.
Avoid tropical climates as the plant prefers a seasonal temperature variation.
Hawthorns can tolerate some degree of cold, making them suitable for cooler regions.
English Hawthorn grows best in regions with moderate humidity and adequate rainfall.
sunlight: English Hawthorn thrives in full sun, requiring at least 6 hours of direct sunlight daily.
Partial shade is tolerated but may result in less optimal flowering and growth.
Ensure the plant receives ample sunlight to maintain its health and vigor.
Too much shade may lead to poor flowering and leggy growth issues in Hawthorns.
watering: Regular watering is needed, especially during dry spells, to keep the soil moist.
Avoid overwatering as waterlogged conditions can lead to root rot problems.
During hot and dry periods, increase the frequency of watering to prevent stress.
Maintain a consistent watering schedule to support the plant's growth and flowering.
soil: Well-draining soil is essential to prevent water accumulation around roots.
English Hawthorn favors loamy soils rich in organic matter for optimal growth.
Slightly acidic to neutral pH levels in the soil are beneficial for this plant.
Good aeration in the soil will promote healthy root development and stability.
toxic: The seeds of the English Hawthorn contain cyanogenic compounds and are toxic if ingested in large quantities.
extra_care_tip: Prune annually in late winter or early spring to maintain shape and encourage new growth.
